sentences.en: After a 6 year apprenticeship I became a journeyman at 19.
sentences.cn: 学徒六年后,我19岁,那时我已经是一名熟练工.

sentences.en: After getting out of school at 15 , he started apprenticeship at Goupil & Cie .
sentences.cn: 在7年的学徒期间, 梵高 觉得自己对绘画兴趣索然,并决定从事神职.

sentences.en: After I served my apprenticeship, I still lived in misery.
sentences.cn: 我满师之后, 生活仍然很惨.

sentences.en: After serving his apprenticeship as a toolmaker, he became a manager.
sentences.cn: 结束了工具匠的学徒期以后，他当上了经理。

sentences.en: Benjamin was bred a silk dyer an apprenticeship in London.
sentences.cn: 拜雅明是学染丝的,在伦敦当学徒.

sentences.en: He is not yet out of his apprenticeship.
He served his apprenticeship with Bob.
He was able to serve his apprenticeship as a trainer with Eddie Futch.
sentences.cn: 他当时师从埃迪·富齐学当拳击教练员。

sentences.en: He’s serving an apprenticeship as a printer.
sentences.cn: 他现在是一名印刷工学徒。

sentences.en: Maybe there was something to apprenticeship in the Middle Ages.
sentences.cn: 也许中世纪的学徒制有值得借鉴的东西.

sentences.en: Relevant qualifications and training, including special training and apprenticeship.
sentences.cn: 有关的资历及训练, 包括特殊训练及学徒训练.

sentences.en: Tay contends the apprenticeship approach produces precisely those kinds of people.
sentences.cn: Tay认为学徒制是培养合格机械师的最佳方式.
我得到了多么好的锻炼 啊 !

sentences.en: Zhao Benshan orphaned at age 6, starting with di ( blind ) apprenticeship.
sentences.cn: 赵本山6岁时成为孤儿, 开始跟二叔 ( 盲人 ) 学艺.

trans.tran_en: the job of being an apprentice, or the period of time in which you are an apprentice
